rules.natural: Either John misses the deadline for feature X, or, if it is not the case that John helping his colleague Mary implies John does not develop the legacy system, then John receives a bonus, and this leads to John getting a promotion.
If Mark conducts a quarterly evaluation of John, then, should Mark conduct a manager review of John, John does not miss the deadline for feature X.
Assuming Sarah performs an HR audit on team Alpha, then if Mark prepares a performance report on John, Mark conducts a quarterly evaluation of John.
Either Sarah performs an HR audit on team Alpha, or Mark holds a team meeting with team Alpha.
In the event that Mark holds a team meeting with team Alpha, then if Mark prepares a performance report on John, Mark conducts a quarterly evaluation of John.
Under the condition that John is assigned to feature X, John passes certification for the new framework.
Either John is assigned to feature X, or it is not the case that John develops the legacy system.
If John completed training in the new framework, then John has skills in Python.
Whenever John passes certification for the new framework, John completed training in the new framework.
Provided that John works on a side project, then John does not develop the legacy system.
Either John works on a side project, or John helps his colleague Mary.

Provided that it is not the case that the non-implication of John helping his colleague Mary leading to John not developing the legacy system results in John receiving a bonus, then John does not get a promotion.
If John does not use a laptop, then John develops the legacy system.
